content.body: Why wasn’t `ignoreList` encoded as a relative list? Everyone’s probably already processing the Array into a Set, we could have run the summation at the same time and saved some bytes.
content.formatted_body: Why wasn’t ignoreList encoded as a relative list? Everyone’s probably already processing the Array into a Set, we could have run the summation at the same time and saved some bytes.

content.body: I tried to sum up that break out discussion we just had here: https://github.com/tc39/source-map/pull/102

content.formatted_body:
function fn() {
  beforeF;
  let num = 3;
  beforeI;
  console.log("Hello from inside!", num);
  afterI;
  afterF;
}
fn(1);
